title: Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore: Operating Hours & Seasons
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Operating Hours & Seasons              Operating Hours & Seasons        Miners Castle Road in autumn (NPS photo)        Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore is open year-round, 24 hours day, though many roads are closed by snow in the winter. There is no entrance fee.  Four Seasons to Enjoy There is no particular "best" season to visit the park for each has its own charm and variety of activities. In the spring, wildflowers bloom in great profusion to add to the beauty of the natural area. The summer brings pleasantly warm weather and abundant sunshine. Autumn boasts a colorful display as the hardwood forest changes color. A mantle of snow sets the stage for winter activities.  Operating Hours - Visitor Centers The Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore - Hiawatha National Forest Interagency Visitor Center is open year round, Monday through Saturday, 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. (closed Sundays and federal holidays). It is open daily from Memorial Day weekend through September with extended operating hours. The Grand Sable Visitor Center is open daily from the Friday just before Memorial Day through the end of September. Hours are 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.  Miners Castle Information Center and Munising Falls Visitor Center are open daily, mid-June through mid-September. Hours are 9 am to 5 pm. The hours and season length may change as funding and staffing permits.  The Au Sable Lighthouse and Maritime Museum are open with guided interpretive tours from mid-June through the end of September. The Au Sable Light Station grounds are open year round.  Park headquarters at Sand Point in Munising is open year round, 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday, but closed on federal holidays.
